comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1) AppleWebKit/535.1 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/14.0.835.202 Safari/535.1

Steps to reproduce:

On a webpage which allows me to upload a file, I clicked on "Browse..." (The <input type="file" /> element). 
When the "File Upload" dialog pops up, instead of selecting a file from local, I typed in a remote address, e.g.:
http://www.google.com.hk/images/srpr/logo3w.png



Actual results:

After entering the address, I clicked "Open" on the "File Upload" dialog screen to confirm "uploading" the file. 
Nothing happened, as if the "Open" button does not do anything.


Expected results:

I have two machines - one with Windows 7 and the other with Ubuntu - both with Firefox 7.0.1.
On Windows 7, I can enter a remote address and "upload" correctly. 
On Ubuntu, it doesn't do anything when I click on "Open".

comments.raw_text: I can reproduce this issue with latest Aurora 28.0a2 (build ID: 20131223004002) on Ubuntu 13.10 32-bit.
